result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick John Litschke

records.addlTxt: 2:31 PM Defendant Frederick John Litschke in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Frederick John Litschke.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  PLQ and DJOC filed in court.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to Ct 1 as charged, asking Court to adopt a DJOC.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1; Counts 2 and 3 are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept DJOC agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept DJOC agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  Victim, appears by video, makes a statement.  Court adopts DJOC agreement.  Clerk to transfer $150 bond to DA to cover DA administrative fee.  Bond continues while agreement is open.  Discussion of the bond- no actual bond ever signed.  No abusive contact with the victim.

10:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick John Litschke in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Frederick John Litschke. Victim also appears by video in court, wishing to make a statement.  Victim makes a statement.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: offer presented and might resolve case.  Likely needs a plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:32 AM Defendant, Frederick John Litschke, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: request additional status.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:27 PM Defendant, Frederick John Litschke, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Victim by video.  All other parties appear in person.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Frederick John Litschke

Prior: 12785 James Ave, Hastings, MN 55033

records.addlTxt: Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

No contact with the victim or residence.  The defendant may make 1 trip to the residence with law enforcement to collect his personal belongings.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

[Defendant bonded out on citations and is not aware of this bond]
